column5: Hi all,Just a quick update on the ice conditions up here in Dryden on Lake Wabigoon. Went down to the lake this evening (Thursday 1st May) to check the conditions. There was 2'4" of ice off my skidoo tracks. Some areas were one foot of water with one foot of clear ice. Its gonna be close this year….i'm not too sure it will all be gone in 2 weeks. Here is the video and pics i took out front this evening.
Looks like you left your chisel out there
Still lots of ice over here in Manitouwadge....on my way out the door right now to go ice fishing!!! I'll be shocked if the ice is all gone in 2 weeks.
Looks like you left your chisel out there   LOL…and the camera!!!!

im on a small inland lake in the sault and my lake looks kinda like that. lots of water on the ice the shore lines are breaking up and the springs out on the lake are opened up. i think you could get a boat in 2 weeks with ice bergs floating around

Still lots of ice over here in Manitouwadge....on my way out the door right now to go ice fishing!!! I'll be shocked if the ice is all gone in 2 weeks.  I'm flying out of White River on June 6 now, not worried about that. But I'm now slated to fish a small brook trout lake NW of Wawa on May 21. That could be dicey I think.....
I take the first holes are from the skate rink?  When it,s all gone Simon,you,ll be wishing the snow and ice was back.LOL
i was up in the park about 100km south of wawa and it was all open. there was still ice on superior but its going to break up real soon
Anyone know the ice out situation on Lake Nipigon?  Headed there end of the month assuming I don't need the ice breaker.
Locked with ice.. last I heard from Thunder Bay.
I'm headed up to the Massey/Espanola area on the may long weekend.  Anyone know what things are like around there?
all open Dunner.  In Elliott Lake anyway.  I'm sure you're good to go
